messageBody:
Hello

I have a problem. I'm trying to write an elegant unit test that compares two Array's of Doubles. Obviously these values are unlikly to be the same and to add another aspect, some of them can be NaN's. My current solution is

for(int i=0; i< result.length; i++)
{
if(expected[i].isNaN())
{
assertThat(result[i], is(Double.NaN));
}
else
{
assertThat(result[i], closeTo(expected[i],1E-14));
}

}

What I would really like to do is

assertThat(result, closeTo(expected,1E-14))

This means that the closeTo Matcher must understand Arrays and must process NaN's correctly (i.e. NaN == NaN returns true)

Does anyone know if this is possible. I hanven't got that much experience using hamcrest assertions so excuse me if it's obvious.
